action.action-desc: Mrs. Noem (for herself, Mr. Cramer, and Mr. Peterson) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food Security Act of 1985 with respect to the administration of wetland determinations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Wetland Determinations Efficiency and Transparency Act.
Section 1222(a) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3822(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking subsection (b) and paragraph (6) and inserting subsection (b), paragraphs (6) and (7), and paragraphs (1)(B) and (2) of section 1244(e); and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: The Secretary, acting through the Chief of the Natural Resources Conservation Service, shall ensure the completion of a wetland delineation, determination, or certification by the date that is 60 days after the date on which a person subject to this subtitle requests the delineation, determination, or certification.

If a wetland delineation, determination, or certification is not completed by the date described in clause (i), upon completion of the wetland delineation, determination, or certification, the Secretary shall provide for a reasonable transition period for coming into compliance with the wetland delineation, determination, or certification, as necessary, and a person shall not become ineligible under section 1221 for program loans or payments as a result of actions taken, between the date described in clause (i) and the date on which such transition period ends, in violation of the wetland delineation, determination, or certification.

subparagraph.text: A wetland delineation, determination, or certification made by the Secretary shall be considered a final agency action subject to judicial review, and a person challenging a wetland delineation, determination, or certification shall not be required to exhaust all administrative remedies prior to bringing a suit in Federal court.

In the case of a wetland delineation, determination, or certification for which there exists a dispute, the Secretary shall make available a copy of the agency record, to a person involved in the dispute who requests such a copy, not later than 30 days after the date on which the person makes the request.
In the case of a wetland delineation, determination, or certification for which there exists a dispute, the Secretary shall bear the burden of proof by a preponderance of the evidence.

Nothing in this paragraph shall be construed to prohibit a person challenging a wetland delineation, determination, or certification from using the administrative appeal process in place before the date of enactment of this paragraph.

section.text: Section 1244(e) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3844(e)) is amended to read as follows:

subsection.header: Provision of technical assistance by other sources

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall permit a person to secure technical assistance from an approved source, as determined by the Secretary, other than the Natural Resources Conservation Service—

subparagraph.text: in the preparation and application of a conservation plan under subtitle B or similar plan required as a condition for assistance from the Department of Agriculture; and
in the preparation of a wetland delineation or determination to submit to the Secretary under section 1222.

paragraph.text: If the Secretary rejects a technical determination made by an approved source pursuant to paragraph (1)(A), or a wetland delineation or determination made by an approved source pursuant to paragraph (1)(B), the basis of the Secretary's rejection must be supported by documented evidence.
